website_summaries.verdict: Features the largest breed database available at an affordable price.
pros: Results are available in 2 or 3 weeks
Testing only takes a quick cheek swab
Provides weight guidance to help with nutrition
cons: Some customers report generic results and high rates of "mixed breed" identification

customer_reviews.title: I love my pup and Wisdom Panel!
customer_reviews.text: Wisdom Panel is trustworthy, because I bought it along with Embark (yes I wasted lots of money) and the results came out 90% similar! I'd say Embark is a little more accurate, but it's also twice the cost. :D Wisdom Panel: - Chihuahua 50% - Pomeranian 12.5% - Shih Tzu 12.5% - Undefined breeds 25% Embark: - Chihuahua 36.8% - Pomeranian 15.2% - Shih Tzu 22.5% - Miniature Pinscher 7.9% - Cocker Spaniel 5.2% - Others 12.4% The difference is minimal in my opinion so your call. By the way my dog is very cute!.
customer_reviews.author: Noble the Beast

customer_reviews.title: Exact results on our mixed breed
customer_reviews.text: We knew we had an “almost” Corgi. A rescue, and we had no history other than she was given up. Several differences were apparent, especially the extra large eyes! (Not so apparent on photo, but extra huge.). Doing an internet search I discovered the large eyes vs. size was a Boston Terrier. DNA came back 50% Corgi, 25% Boston Terrier and 25% Chihuahua. We could not be more pleased and will recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Really 99% accurate????????
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this as a second test for my Heinz 57 pup. The first test came back with results of 5 breeds that did not appear to match her looks or personality. Even though we read that testing is 99% accurate, my question is, how do you know unless you test again. So this was my second test. Results came back with a mix of breeds only one breed matched the first results. So now, do we believe the first or the second test results?
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jean

customer_reviews.title: I am completely satisfied with the results as well as the speed with ...
customer_reviews.text: I found my dog picking through trash at a rest stop so I had no real clue other than he had a lot of Husky in him. Just about everyone, including my vet, thought he might be a wolf hybrid. Only one lady who breeds both malamutes and huskys said he was a mix of those two. It turns out she was right and the explanations of the breed characteristics that were provided by the Wisdom panel folks served as further substantiation. I am completely satisfied with the results as well as the speed with which they were returned to me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian L. Bills

customer_reviews.title: this is pretty useless information
customer_reviews.text: Be wary if you have a mixed breed dog. Our dog was identified as 62.5% 'other' mixed breed. Given that I already knew my dog was mixed breed, this is pretty useless information. Would love a 62% discount on the product given the lack of specifics surrounding the analysis.
customer_reviews.author: Rees

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate at all, or we got someone else's result
customer_reviews.text: This is my healthy weight 110 Lb dog. We know his mother is a purebred Bernese Mountain dog, we are unsure of the father and this is why we wanted to do this test. The test came back with this result; 25% Border Collie 25% Labrador Retriever 12.5% Australian Shepherd 12.5% Bichon Frise 12.5% Chow Chow 12.5% Breed Group(s) Healthy Weight - 41 lbs - 67 lbs
customer_reviews.author: Gregor Visconty

customer_reviews.title: but super interesting to know their heritage
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs have all gotten these for their adoption anniversary's. It's nothing necessary, but super interesting to know their heritage. I can only imagine this would be helpful if you live in a state with BSL as it can possibly disprove someone claiming your dog is a breed they aren't. We have a dog that everyone assumes is a 85 pound pit bull. She is actually half lab and half great Dane. Have no idea how she ended up looking like a bully, but she did. Genetics are funny like that.
customer_reviews.author: MenehuneirieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used on 2 of my dogs. One came back that we had a 100% purebred labrador retriever ( we always wondered as we got her from craigslist, so we wouldn't have been surprised for her not to be 100%) and the other was for our shelter dog, a little white fluff mutt who turned out to be a "designer mix" that people breed. He is a 50% lhasa apso and 50%Bichon Frise. Interesting to find out. Easy to do the test and fill out the information online. Results were back in less than 2 weeks. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura DeJong

customer_reviews.title: Congratulations to those of you who had good results with the test
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work for me. Turnaround time was normal. The test indicated I had a 100% full-blooded miniature poodle with an average weight of 15 to 27 pounds. My 9-month-old weighs 5 pounds, and I do not foresee her gaining 10+ pounds in the next 3 months. She is not a full-blooded poodle, much less a miniature poodle. Congratulations to those of you who had good results with the test. It just did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: Must have switched samples in the lab...
customer_reviews.text: The wait is finally over and i received my results. My pup is definitely a mix, i just wanted to identify whether his short red coat and size came from. Well this test gave me back 62% rottweiler mixed with an american bulldog and a wheaton terrier. Look at the pictures of my pup and you judge for yourself. I'm contacting customer service as it would appear my sample was compromised or mixed with another dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Luy

customer_reviews.title: Test report and site difficulty
customer_reviews.text: This is what I sent Wisdom, with a photo of Oliver: Report unsatisfactory: I can read the full page summary but attempts to print summary on Chrome and Firefox only gave me error messages. Most important, Oliver is a healthy 35 pounds in appearance, behavior and according to his veterinarian. You give 13-24 lb as range. He would be dead at 13 and severely underweight, perhaps dead, at 24. I am attaching a photo of Oliver. Broad chested and powerful for his 35 pounds. Is this 50/50 Bichon Frise/Shih Tzu? Please respond.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Robins

customer_reviews.title: So glad I tried it!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of these tests, but a good friend who works with DNA herself ran it on her dog and confirmed that the test was reliable. So I tried it on my dog, and my beloved derpy German shepherd mix turned out to be a German shepherd - golden retriever - shar pei - chow mix. I had a trainer once tell me that he was likely part shar pei, and she was right. Collecting the cheek swab was easy. I'm glad I know what his silly ears are made of now!
customer_reviews.author: H. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: They updated the way results are presented and it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: They updated the way results are presented and it's not even close to what was show in the advertisement. Very generic information provided. Your vet could make a more accurate guess. Not worth the money at all.
customer_reviews.author: solomon a.

customer_reviews.title: We feel our results and the process was efficient and accurate
customer_reviews.text: We are satisfied with both the process and results of this test. The rescue organization had our dog as a Rat Terrier/Jack Russell mix and the vet agreed. One of our neighbors was certain she was a Jack Rusell/Chihuahua mix. The test detailed it to 25% Toy Fox Terrier, 25% Parson (Jack Rusell) Terrier, 25% Chihuahua and 25% Mix Terrier. We feel this is extremely accurate given her behaviors. I'd do this test again on any other dog we may end up getting, and I would recommend this test to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dooney Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: No Pomerianian/Terrier here.
customer_reviews.text: Was so happy we did this. No more questioning what kind of puppy we got. Though we were told she was Pomeranian/terrier we knew that was wrong when she started growing at light speed.. come to find out shes 50% German Shepherd and a mix of Collie and Border Collie. That's more like it. Not our 20lb puppy we were expecting but we love her. Rescue is still always the best.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: I personally think it was worth the money and I enjoyed finding out my puppy's lineages
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a puppy from our local humane society and was told he was a shih-tzu pug mix, however, no one I talked to could see the pug in him. I decided to do a DNA test to see exactly what he is and found out that he was mostly shih-tzu and chihuahua with just a tiny bit of pug and lhasa apso. There was 12.5% that was "mixed-breed groups" but the test gives you lists of which groups that unknown amount may come from. The test also gave weight estimates for him! I personally think it was worth the money and I enjoyed finding out my puppy's lineages.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Very suspect return
customer_reviews.text: Personally I feel like they pulled a card out of the drawer and sent it. my dog exhibits zero traits of any of the breeds they returned on the analysis. I used a different vendor on a past dog and could actually see the traits of the dog matching part of the analysis. Zero with this one I can’t prove it but I truly believe it’s a scam . If I Google golden retriever sheltie mix I see hundreds of pictures that look similar to exactly like my dog, neither of which were mentioned in the analysis . Spend the extra money and use a premium vendor .
customer_reviews.author: TLMJR

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend!
customer_reviews.text: The test was easy enough to swab. The identified breeds don’t really match up with what my dog looked like. They said my dog was 1/2 Australian cattle dog while it’s definity possible for some, half is a bit to generous. They didn’t identify my dog as having any Rottweiler and the father was 1/2 Rottweiler. The mother of I recall was 3/4 Alaskan husky and 1/4 Siberian husky. I contacted the company and they explained the results but it’s not a very good explanation nor accurate. I would not reccomend this company to anyone for testing their dog.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Would like to redo it with another company’s kit
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really know what to say. I’m not convinced it’s accurate. Every vet she’s been to says she looks like a golden mix. She has the temperament of a golden, the soft fur, the ears, tail, haunches, and size of a golden. We thought golden and boxer because she has crazy long arms, hugs you and kind of throws punches, and has white on her chest and chin as well as white toe socks. She came back as American Staffordshire Terrier, Akita, Chow Chow, and Basset Hound. I’m just not convinced.
customer_reviews.author: MElder

customer_reviews.title: too expensive for results
customer_reviews.text: We went for the more expensive pet DNA report ($84.49) - thinking it would be more complete...NOT We were foolish -- $30 would be alot for the report we got....Does the dog in that picture look like he has a pekingese parent?? - Very generic health report "multi drug sensitivity - clear" ... "Ideal weight 8-16 lbs"..... and that''s it!!! Save your $ go for the lesser expensive report.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Waters

customer_reviews.title: Seems accurate!
customer_reviews.text: LOL- I ordered this to prove to the vet that my dog doesn’t actually weigh twice what he should for a Lab. I was certain he had some Newfoundland in him. Nope. 87% Lab - apparently 13% total food addict.
customer_reviews.author: M. Joiner

customer_reviews.title: My dog makes sense now
customer_reviews.text: I thought my little rescue was a yorkie/shih tzu mix. I got the results today, about 3 weeks after I sent it in. The results say she's primarily chihuahua and miniature poodle. I Googled "chipoo" and about 500 images that look just like my dog popped up. I never would have guessed! I'm very, very happy with Wisdom Panel.
customer_reviews.author: Kelikana

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: So we have a very obvious Australian Shepard but we thought he had some type of lab or golden retriever mixed in and we took this test and it came back saying our dog was 75% terrier with an ideal weight of 34 lbs. He’s a medium sized dog who’s a very active, lean and healthy 55lbs. Complete waste of money with 0 accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: John & Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of Money!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about doing this test for our beloved elderly dog. We knew his mother was a Schnoodle but dad was a mystery. Our boy looks like a Schnauzer with curls (poodle) on top his head. His test came back with crazy breeds identified and no where in his report was Schnauzer or Poodle mentioned. Did they mix up his sample? I don't know. But I can tell you no one responded to our questions. This was a huge waste of money and a complete disappointment. I DO NOT recommend. Edit: The company has responded and they are reviewing our case. I will update this again after all is said and done.
customer_reviews.author: GarDogAngel

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The results came back that our dog was Golden Retriever, German Sheppard, Border Collie and a mix. We know for a fact that her mother was pure Lab. One of two dogs was the sire, a Rottweiler or Doberman. Those were the only two males that had access to her mother. These test results are way off, I expected better after our first experience with you which was very good. I will not recommend your product. I tried to leave this review on the company website but unless you give the product two or more stars, you cannot submit the review! That's one way of getting positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Mackey

customer_reviews.title: Surprise! Pure Bred Staffy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third Wisdom Panel I've administered to my shelter dogs- the first two resulted in mixed results for my two brindle babies but this third knocked me for a loop. Expecting either a Pit Bull mix with Catahoula or Lab or something (I got him at the county shelter) the 3.0 test came back as 100% pure bred American Staffordshire Terrier. Given his coloring (judge for yourself) I thought he'd be a mix for sure. Too bad we got him fixed. LOL. Anyway, I think Wisdom Panel nailed this one.
customer_reviews.author: Neil P.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to help verify that our dog's breeds. If you Google poodle/Australian shepherd, and that's exactly what Henry looks like. Our DNA results? they say he's 75% Chihuahua, 12.5% Miniature Pinscher, and 12.5% other. What a joke. Also, obtaining the sample involves swabbing the dog's mouth with 2 swabs, then doing it again an hour later. I don't know about your dog, but getting Henry to co-operate with this is like giving a dental exam to a Great White Shark. Something else: We got this $80 kit, but they have a $160 kit. Why? is it more accurate? Honestly, save your money. Your vet can make pretty educated guesses, then start searching mixes.
customer_reviews.author: steve clark

customer_reviews.title: A year ago two horribly malnourished dogs showed up at our house and stole ...
customer_reviews.text: A year ago two horribly malnourished dogs showed up at our house and stole our hearts. We slowly nursed them back to great heath with the help of our veterinarian. But we had no idea what breeds they were or what heath issues we may need to watch out for so we ordered the wisdom panel for both of our fur babies. Waiting for the results is like waiting for Christmas. When we got them back it was VERY COOL. Some of it was what we expected and some wasn't. We took the results to the vet and he told us the things we should be watching out for based on the breeds. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a mastiff mix. Owner said mixed with lab. My trainer who has trained military and police dogs for most of her adult years and now trains service dogs says it's not a lab mix. I did the wisdom panel test, results 35% Rottweiler 24% Mastiff 12 % small terrier rest is mix. I told my trainer the results. She said a group sent in 3 dna samples from many pure breed dogs to 3 of the largest companies doing dna testing. One in three were came back correct yet never the same company. My dog definitely is not Rottweiler. I wouldn't waste my money.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal and buy Quality

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: My dog's DNA came back 12.5% Chihuahua, 12.5% Cocker Spaniel, 12.5% Lhasa Apso, 62.5% Breed Groups with 4 groups listed (Herding, Terrier, Asian and Sporting). So basically I just wasted $70 to find out my dog is a mutt of a mutt, something I already knew. I am disappointed that it is so general and not very specific. Really? 62.5% of my dog's DNA is some combination of 4 totally different groups of dogs? Too bad, we were really looking forward to the results. Did not work at all for us. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Pros - easy to use and postage was paid, so easy to mail back. Like the emails with status updates and well-designed report: Cons - took a week for them to acknowledge sample was received (I tracked it). Report had 3 breeds at 12.5% each. 62.5% was unknown from the sporting/herding/Asian groups, which is a ton of breeds and tells us nothing. In other words, this was a waste of $80. Wish they’d offer a money back guarantee that if they can’t identify a certain amount of DNA, you get a portion refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall45

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Results. 75% Mixed Breed?
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with our results. 75% mixed breed? We thought we would know at least what 50% of our dog is. It's important to understand while lots of dog breeds genetic information is in the system, not all are. All we know now is we officially have a "Mega Mutt."
customer_reviews.author: Courtney P.

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to do, two swabs given with instructions on how to collect the samples. A return box with a return label was provided. The results came in the exact amount of time they estimated. My dog is a rescue, so we has little information as to what his history was. He came back 62.5% American Staffordshire terrier, 12.5% Lab, 12.5% German shepherd and 12.5% of the breed groups hound and guard. Staffy and lab were suspected, I hadn't thought of german shepherd. Overall a very fun thing to do and cool to know a little bit more about our furry family member!
customer_reviews.author: BasmatiBurner

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I have a18 pound dog that looks like a mix of black lab and dachshund with a shiny black coat and floppy ears. I was so excited to find out what he really is a mix of. Well I was extremely disappointed as the results showed he was a mix of poodle and cocker spaniel. Not even close to possible so I consider this a waste of money. My daughter is a geneticist and even she shook her head at results. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Results seem accurate, process was easy
customer_reviews.text: I have been so curious to know what this dog was, and I finally satisfied that curiosity with this test! Turns out this handsome boy is 25% Chihuahua, 25% miniature poodle, 25% jack Russell, 12.5% Pomeranian and only 12.5% "mixed breed". I can live with that amount of unknown, and the breeds given all seem to fit. Directions were easy to follow and the kit was simple to mail back. Test results came within the estimated window even though Christmas fell right in the middle of it. I was somewhat expecting delayed results because of the timing, but that wasn't the case. Would recommend this test, and eventually want to get a second one for my other dog.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: NOT a chorkie!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Wisdom Panel service. My puppy was sold to me as a chorkie. Well, that's half true I guess. See pictures. They were fast with my results. I thought it would take longer. I think it was about 1 week after they received my swabs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Crowe

customer_reviews.title: I LOVED this.!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It's super easy to use. You just scrub your puppers cheek with the spoolie and let it dry for about 5 minutes. Then you package it back up and send that sucker off. You can go on their website and track the progress of the sample. And they notify you when the sample is done being processed. Then you get to see a little chart of what your pup is made of and so much more!! You get access to a family tree. You can navigate your way through what her parents were, grandparents were, and great grandparents were. Over all this kit is so worth it in my mind. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn H.

customer_reviews.title: Great to know what kind of a dog I have
customer_reviews.text: We picked up a stray and took her in. My husband is a vet and so we guessed at what she is but always wondered. We sent this in and were shocked at the result and didn't believe it. But when we looked up the mix on the web - it looked just like her! Also, when I looked up the individual breeds (she was mostly just 2), the social characteristics it her to a T. Very cool!
customer_reviews.author: I'm a mom

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us, but great product and company!
customer_reviews.text: Process was very easy and straightforward. Our dog was classified as a "mega mutt," and when they couldn't provide a lot of meaningful information, they offered us a full refund! Very sweet and legit company.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Schuknecht

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Adopted a mixed lab rescue dog last year. He was a stray, so there was no way to know his history. He looks like a black lab but has a strange build, so we ordered this. We were impressed with the quick processing and detailed responses. As it turns out, our dog is not a lab at all! The results were surprising and fascinating.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Mixed breed dog? Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: The process was quick and straightforward, but the results have me feeling I wasted my money. My "hound mix"s results were 25% foxhound, 25% treeing walker coonhound, and 50% mixed breed. I know she's a mixed breed, that's why I sent the sample in in the first place. In my opinion, if your dog is a very strange mix of many different breeds, save your money. This test won't tell you much. We will still be introducing our Ember as a hound mix.
customer_reviews.author: M. Shearer

customer_reviews.title: Useless unless they activate your kit
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived quickly and was easy to use. Registration is a whole other matter. I registered the kit but it isn't activated until they send you an email. Well, I have tried over and over, on different computers to request my email and no email from them. And of course no email or phone # to contact. This was hours ago, and no it isn't in my spam folder. So far they get 1 star. If they actually activate it I'll raise the score.
customer_reviews.author: MicheleP

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS IT IS A SCAM AND WASTE OF MONEY IT GIVES YOU ZERO INFORMATION ABOUT YOUR DOG
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS! We adopted a dog and wanted to know his breed. The results came in and he’s 37% staffordshire terrier and 63% three different breed groups (breed groups include well over 10 / 20 dog breeds EACH). This did not narrow it down in any way when he could primarily be one of 60 dog breeds. Then this wisdom panel says his ideal weight will be 44-74 lbs. that doesn’t exactly narrow it down either !!! The health information is nonexistent. Basically this is a HUGE WASTE of money and you get virtually ZERO information on the health, breed, etc. What a joke I feel so scammed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst DNA Test Ever
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about trying a DNA test for my dog until my vet recommended wisdom panel. It was a COMPLETE waist of money and a scam. I sent my swabs in and after an excessive waiting period, they told me that my dog was 33 percent chihuahua and the rest was God knows what. They suggested that the unknown breed was some form of a shepherd. She is looks like a chihuahua and is 6.5 pounds after a larger than normal breakfast. I DON'T THINK SHE'S A SHEPHERD. The swabs were also a nightmare to put in her mouth and she is generally vey patient.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste the money
customer_reviews.text: I had full faith in this... until I got my results. We have a dog that looks mostly yellow lab but the vet said she’s mixed with German Shepherd but we thought maybe beagle instead, the consensus has been 50/50 from friends and strangers alike. Finally committed to the DNA test and anxiously awaited the results. We got them back and they made NO sense for my dog. I did a poll on a few social media platforms and it’s agreed upon that these results must be incorrect. I emailed the company to question them with no response. Don’t bother.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: No customer support, poor accuracy. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I got 3 of these for my dogs. I wish I would have ordered a different brand. My biggest issues were that I tried to contact customer service twice (about 2 months ago) and got zero response back. They also require a photo of your dog prior to sending in the sample. Makes me wonder if they're just looking at the dog and guessing. My shepherd (who is an obvious shepherd) came back as mostly doberman which I thought was weird. At this price I would definitely recommend purchasing a different brand. This was a huge waste of $300
customer_reviews.author: #GoKingsGo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: So I was very eager to get the results back since I have always wanted to know what breed my dog is since I know dhe is not a pure breed and a rescue. I wait 3 weeks and I get the results and it basically tells me what I already know that my dog is 75% terrier and the 25% could be up to about a dozen other breeds with no specifics. She could part mountain dog or german shepard or husky... I bought this kit because I wanted specifics on that 25% not just a general idea. I wasted $80 for some company to tell me what I already knew just by looking at my dog.
customer_reviews.author: X-Ray

customer_reviews.title: My Wheaten/Poodle apparently isn't!
customer_reviews.text: This test has some great veterinary reviews. I'm confused why this one has 250 breeds, whereas the other Wisdom tests have 350 breeds. That said! I adopted a WheatiePoo that has every personality trait, and the instincts of a terrier. Guess what? She's apparently 12% Pomeranian 12% Miniature Poodle 12% Shih Tzu 12% Pekingese and 50% something they have no idea of, that runs from first to third generation, and is either a hunting or sporting breed. No terrier at all! Apparently, Sarah is a 17"/30lb, purebred Fluffy McNugget, who has a high prey drive and herding instinct, and is a belly rub addict. 5 stars for amusement factor.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and probably inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on prime day because I regret not doing it on my first rescue doggo. So, my second pupper I got the test after talking to someone about them at the dog park. I was so excited for the results. He is definitely a corgi but I wanted to know what else. I got the results and it said no corgi, mini poodle. So I figure, I’m no scientist who knows. It went through a couple inane possibilities and then said “50% is unknown”. What? First of all, these seem quite off but 50% could be anything and would be the majority. I asked why I do I not pay 50% is they can only identify 50%.
customer_reviews.author: Meg mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Most Scientific and Credible Tests -- SPOT ON!
customer_reviews.text: These are really great. I'm a scientist, so I know what I want to see when I pay for a scientific test. I have ordered Wisdom Panels for three different dogs over the past 18 mo this, and, clearly, as they gain data they are improving what was already a really great product.
customer_reviews.author: InspectorGirl

customer_reviews.title: 50% Unknown
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing to get the results after weeks of waiting and having 50% of my dog’s ancestry as unknown and then given 4 possible categories of dogs it could be (like sporting, work, etc groups) which each contain several dog breeds. At that point, what was the point of the test? I knew he was a dog going in, and that’s about all it told me. Coulda saved a few bucks or spent it on treats for him instead. Oh well. Of course I adore him whatever he’s made up of, so if you’re just interested in this for a little fun, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: ladyabbies

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool.
customer_reviews.text: I thought my pound puppy was a Westie / Shih Tzu mix but his results were 25% Shih Tzu, 25% Miniature Poodle, 12.5% Yorkie, 12.5% Chihuahua, 12.5% Pekingese and 12.5% Bichon Frise (not a drop of a West Highland White Terrier, though his pure white fur must be coming from the Bichon). Super cool! Was a little disappointed there was no information related to his health but was actually nervous to see that as well (not wanting bad news and all). The Family Tree was a little suspect as well - it claimed Iggy's grandparents were the exact same mix of his parents (that would be pretty coincidental).
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: Results seem accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted an adult dog from the shelter and wanted to know what he was. He’s about 35 pounds and was listed as a “beagle/hound mix” at the shelter. Since I haven’t met his parents, I can’t say for sure, but the results make sense based on his appearance and his baying/howling/herding habits. Note that the company had his weight and DNA swab and no other information when they gave me his results. His results were ready 15 days after they arrived at the lab. The test requires two cheek swabs, which I had no issue getting (my dog sometimes gets his teeth brushed so is used to things moving around in his mouth, though he’s not a big fan).
customer_reviews.author: Unreliable Narrator

customer_reviews.title: You've got to be kidding!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what algorithm the dog saliva is run through, but I've got a 42-pound long skinny black and white spotted dog with short hair, long legs and a curved tail. She came up Staffordshire Terrier (a breed of Pit), Chow-chow and Great Pyrenees Mountain dog. Okay. I can see a little bit of Pit in her face, but nothing else. I'm wondering if they mixed her up with another dog?
customer_reviews.author: bbnn

customer_reviews.title: Offers valuable information from DNA sample.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very satisfied with Wisdom Panel 3.0! Collecting the sample from our dog was easy as well as mailing it in with postage paid. We received the results in the time we were told. Loved reading about our dog’s various breeds in her DNA! There were some real surprises. I recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Thiede

customer_reviews.title: I wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Chinese crested and German Shepherd? Cocker Spaniel and Weimeriner? Some chow and Breed Group, maybe. But seriously, I was really looking forward to receiving results and thought The few bad reviews were because of sloppy dna collections. I was very careful to follow directions and get a good sample that was not contaminated by food, toys, anything. But I think the lab is able to actually mess up sometimes and completely miss the mark. In my case I feel stupid for wasting my money. I will continue calling my boy a retriever, border collie mix, since that is what he resembles and acts like to me.
customer_reviews.author: nanabon

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing! Results are vague and pretty useless.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Wisdom Panel to learn more about our newly adopted brindle shelter mutt, Hazel. We only received an answer for 1 of 4 grandparents and it was the only breed we were already pretty sure of. Over 60% of her DNA was labeled as being from three possible breed groups. Looks like we will be shelling out double to try Embark. Bummer!!! To be fair, these are some of the worst results I’ve seen online. It appears that many others had better luck. ETA: I did pay for the competitors DNA test and they were able to pinpoint 94% of her DNA. Much better!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie B

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate—go for Embark!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a dog breed expert by any means, but I know more than most. I took their mixed breed quiz and got at least one breed correct, if that says anything. That being said, the results that came back for our dog are just...wrong. The personality traits and physical features just don’t match up. After I shared the results my dog-savvy friends told me the results are not that accurate for Wisdom, and that Embark is MUCH better. That being said, the kit was easy to use, and the result turnaround time was great, hence 1 extra star.
customer_reviews.author: Sammitch

customer_reviews.title: Worked quickly and so much fun to know!
customer_reviews.text: Totally awesome! Gave results back within less than two weeks. We have a little supposedly chihuahua, that looks like a minpin. Her results came back 50% chihuahua, 25% minpin, 25% miniature poodle. Really fun. So it fits the “word of mouth story” that she’s chihuahua, but explains why she looks like a minpin. Also explained Doberman pinschers were bred to look like miniature pinschers, not the other way around. So that was fun to know. Well worth $60 if you can afford it to splurge on such a thing. They have no idea what your dog looks like or what size they are during the process, so it’s 100% legit. Pretty cool ;)
customer_reviews.author: jmsh

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a purebred Maltese.. however his whole life (he's 4) everyone including our vet and groomer say that they think he's a maltipoo or some sort of mix, yet he is AKC registered, so we bought a test! Super easy to use, swab the inside of the dogs cheek, send in the samples and activate your test. You don't give them anything except the samples and your name/email so theres no way of them knowing what kind of dog you're sending in. Sure enough, our puppo came back as 100% maltese. It also gave us some health results on him. Results said it would take 3 weeks but we had them back in 10 days
customer_reviews.author: Mj R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this DNA kit to test my 6 month old rescue dog. When the results came back I was very surprised and unsure of the credibility of the kit. At my vet's suggestion, I ordered a second kit from a different company. When the results came back from the second company there was some overlap in breed but the second company was much more thorough in how and what they defined. I wish I had saved my money and gone with the second company in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Gardener Girl

customer_reviews.title: Finally figured out what our Mutt is!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing much to say....quick, easy, and pretty cool. Everyone kept guessing what kind of dog she is. The vet didn't even know, but she knew that other guesses were wrong. She recommended this test and we're super excited we did it. Very inexpensive to discover what she's "made of". It also answers some behavioral questions since each breed has there own characteristics...yes, I know, that's not PC this day and age...every dog should be equal and are robots and exactly the same. But lets be real...knowing the breed (because science does say that different breeds have different temperaments, triggers, and personalities) will help you train and keep your dog happy, healthy, and entertained.
customer_reviews.author: I'm Me

customer_reviews.title: It worked! 100% recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: We rescued a 4 month old puppy, they found mom on the streets and only knew she was a German Shepard. no clue about the dad. Was pretty cool to find out he had 1/4 boxer and 1/4 mastiff in him. ** The test itself if pretty easy to use, you rub 2 small swab sticks (like a pipe cleaner with with a mini toilet brush on the end) between your dogs gum and lip. Spin it, rib it, twist it. It takes like 30 seconds then you let them dry and put them in the container to mail back. Takes about 2 weeks to get the results back. 100% worth it!. HIGHLY RECOMMEND and also makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Nope, doesn't add up...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about finally knowing what my rescue mutt was made out of. My vet had him pegged has a beagle mix. I agreed but wanted to know more. Got the kit the day after I ordered it and had the results two weeks later. 25% miniature people, 25% miniature schnauze, 12.5% bichon frise, 12.5% Chihuahua, 12.5% Pekingese. !?! Look I wouldn't mind owning any of those dogs.. I love dogs!! But Taco's size, fur, characteristics, color, personality don't not fall in line with these breeds.. IMO.. maybe I am wrong? Maybe I should send them my Chihuahuas DNA just incase he is actually a bulldog, Greyhound, Boston terrier mix.. see pic
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was disappointing. Our dog looks like a miniature chocolate Lab, and we wondered what he was mixed with to make him smaller. The results came back 50% American Staffordshire terrier, and we could see that in him. The other 50% was "sporting breed" which could have been anything from a spaniel to a German shepherd. We decided that the other 50% must be Lab, since that's what he looks most like, but, come on. I didn't spend $85 to find out he was half "sporting breed". Surely they could have been more specific.
customer_reviews.author: EALowe

customer_reviews.title: Huge wast of money. Up to 65% can comeback in a group like herding, or Asian (no specific breed).
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that a large percent can come back as breed groups!! Wisdom will not specify a breed it will list is as Herding, Terrier, Asian etc. You can get up to 65% comeback in a group (no specific breed). If I would have know this I would have spent the extra money and went with Embark DNA as they list all the breeds down to single percentages! I knew the mother was Border collie and the father is Great pyrenees but she has a Rough collie face very slanted and collie colors (orange and white) The results came back 50% unspecified. They were thrown in a breed group which doesn't help me at all! Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S.

customer_reviews.title: 2 different companies, 2 very different results
customer_reviews.text: I ordered both the wisdom panel kit and findmypetdna kit and both came back with total different results. Wisdom panel contacted me after seeing a one star review and explained everything.. i am fully confident that this is the correct one. Their professionalism is top notch. And they really care about your pet and your results. Whatever you chose be wary of a company that won't process your results without a picture....
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Provenz

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed - Not even close
customer_reviews.text: My dog is Australian Shepard and Chocolate Lab. He weights 55 pounds and the vet says he should lose 5. Neither breed was found in his DNA. 25% American Bulldog?!! Rottweiller, Golden Retriever??? They have him weighing 76 + pounds. I would believe it if at least 1 of the his breeds were found. The remaining 50% threw him into 4 breed groups. Very disappointed. I was excited and looking forward to the results.
customer_reviews.author: H.a.m.

customer_reviews.title: Put an end to that curiousity
customer_reviews.text: We love our little rescue dog.. no matter what his mix is. Still,many times I wondered, where that howl came from, certain personality traits etc. So this is a fun thing to try. Relatively easy to use, you have to swab the inside of the dog's cheek with a mascara-like wand. Follow directions, ship it back, and voila! in 2 to 3 weeks you have your result. I already knew my dog was part dachshund.. and sure enough results came back 50% mini dachshund, allowing me a 100% comfort level in the balance of the results. And yes, there was a 25% surprise which now makes total sense. Fun!
customer_reviews.author: insgirl1

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate; save your small fortune.
customer_reviews.text: This test is not accurate. It was purchased for my mixed-breed Chihuahua (who is aesthetically large with squared features), with mixed-breed parents. The results erroneously came back as 100% purebred.
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Fun test for your pupper!
customer_reviews.text: Fun for people who want to find out what breeds are in their dog. A bit high priced though. Had the results in about 3 weeks after I mailed the sample out. My dog came from a shelter and is pretty mixed, so I didn't expect that they would be able to pin down his heritage too much. Results came back they identified two breeds(rat and jack russell terriers), the rest was too mixed to identify... so if your dog is very much a mutt like mine just keep in mind they may only be able to identify 50% or less of his or her breed genetics.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY RECOMMEND. I loved this product! My family rescued a mixed breed puppy from out of state and were so curious about what kind of dog he is! When receiving the kit, the directions were so easy and the dog did not mind the brushing at all! We even got our results back quicker than expected. Our handsom puppy came to be American Staffordshire Terrier,Great Pyrenees, Lab, Hound, and boxer! They gave so much information about who his parents, grandparents, etc could be. The best part was the weight prediction. Since he was so many breeds, it was a nice goal to watch for. I loved looking at health facts and history.
customer_reviews.author: Karrina DePas

customer_reviews.title: The results although slightly surprising seem to be true
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after getting what we supposed was a husky malamute mix from the shelter. We learned he is just an absolute beast of a purebred siberian husky, far larger than the average size listed anywhere I've read online. The test did take a long time to be received but only half the amount of time to be processed, which I found odd with the express shipping. Overall I wish it came with more info on health but I was happy to learn our dog's ideal weight was 80lbs with him being 87. We thought he was far chunkier with everything we read online about weight range.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew George

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money and don’t waste your money on Wisdom Panel!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with Wisdom Dog DNA. We adopted a rescue - knew our puppy was 50% lab and wanted to know what the other 50% was especially due to her size and weight at such an early age. After waiting and anticipation - on Christmas Day - the results revealed she was 50% lab and the other was of the herding group, guard and terrier group. How general can that be. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: YoungIntheUSA

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, clear instructions. The webpage show's the status and progress of your test kit. I received results within 12 days of them receiving my sample. My vet was impressed that they also tested for MDR1 ( multi drug resistance). The results provide both a pie chart break down of the dog breeds and a family tree showing the dogs mix. Information was provided for each breed within the mix.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Results, not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our sweet friendly rescue dog for 2 years. She was identified at the shelter as part Vizsla and mix of hound/heeler. Well, we wanted to know for sure what mixed breeds she was and based on the reviews we bought this DNA test. Big mistake, the results were 50% Australian Cattle dog... No Vizsla... Her behavior truly matches one of Vizsla to a T. She's friendly even to strangers, doesn't bark at all unless chasing bunnies, and is velcro among other things. So, I would say look elsewhere if you have a rescue dog that is a mix breed.
customer_reviews.author: Terry in NW

customer_reviews.title: Fascinating!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this twice now. Last year, we bought it for our rescue “lab/shepherd” dog. Everybody kept asking about her breed, and we were curious ourselves. The test can be a little tricky with a dog who doesn’t want her gum brushed, but we must have collected enough dna to get results. Yay! It turns out, our “lab shepherd” is actually American staffordshire / chow / lab / boxer. The results and family tree are fascinating. We adopted a new puppy this year, and just purchased another kit to learn more about him as well. Can’t wait to get them! I highly recommend this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mama B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I can only say at this point it was easy to use and I’m anxiously awaiting the findings!! This product was recommended to me by my vets office because of their accuracy!! I have now received my dogs panel and was pleased with everything- easiness of the test and the time it took to get the response! The only thing I wished is that they would send the results on paper! They said they would but you have to ask for it! I definitely would recommend this site! My vet recommended them to me Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cindi H Sokol

customer_reviews.title: More scam than not.
customer_reviews.text: Test is 100% incorrect. I assumed the people complaining about it were just too picky and weren’t giving the true weight of skepticism something like this should probably come with. It turns out that it’s far closer to a scam then it is anything legitimate or worthwhile. I was wrong to give the test the benefit of the doubt and I regret using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: doubtful results
customer_reviews.text: 2 rescued dogs.... 1yr and 1 1/2 yr...completely different in looks....body size. and shape......coats dissimiliar in texture and appearance ...DNA comes back BOTH!!!! are Miniture Poodle and Chihuahua!!!! I seriously doubt it!!!!! one has a Maltese face (I have had 4) and has fluffy white hair....the other is multicolored with wavy wiry hair....NOTHING resembling a poodle or a short legged chihuahua!!!!! I just don't buy it.......save your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed- only 1/2 of mix identified
customer_reviews.text: Sent sample & it took about 3 weeks just for them to receive! Results came quick after that, within a week. Our sample came back with 50% identified and the other 50% unidentified. So, the question still remains, what is our dog? I spent the $80 to get that answer & we’ll never know! They said the other 50% could be 1 from about 10-12 other breeds! URGH
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Howen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Detailed report and very quick results
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pure bred golden retriever at 8 weeks old. After a few weeks I noticed changes in her appearance. I knew she wasn’t all golden. I purchased this DNA test kit. I followed the directions and sent the sample. Within 2 weeks I had my results! I was shocked by the results. My puppy is only 25% golden mixed with 4 other breeds. I am so happy with the results! Now I know what breed she’s mixed with and I’m relieved she isn’t mixed with an aggressive breed. a GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy P.

customer_reviews.title: I trust this test
customer_reviews.text: This was such an easy to use test. My dog wasn't really happy with the swab stick, but once we got the first one done, he knew the drill and the next went easier. The company was great about letting me know the test was received, and when results were expected to be ready. Results came sooner than expected. I was prepared for some of the results, but not all. My "wire-haired dachshund" is actually a shih-tzu/dachshund! That explains so much about his crazy coat. I would highly recommend this test to anyone who wants to know more about their pet.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea D. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the test
customer_reviews.text: This was a great experience. The test was super easy to use and I got the results back way faster than estimated. They gave a bunch of different breeds in the makeup of my mixed breed dog, and only about 12.5% of the whole thing consisted of very small percentages of breeds that could not be counted on for accuracy. All of the rest really fit my dog and the percentages were confident. I had questions, and the Wisdom Panel employees spent a lot of time on the phone with me to give really detailed and knowledgeable explanations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy to submit and accurate results!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted my pup as an adult. He was a former stray so his parentage was unknown and I’ve always been curious. I chose this kit because it had the best price and good reviews. It did not disappoint! The step by step directions to submit your sample are very clear and easy to follow. It does take a few weeks for results to come in. Based on my dogs personality and physical characteristics, it looks like the results are accurate! I do wish they could be more specific, instead of the “25% breed groups” but that’s likely not even possible. Thank you Wisdom Panel!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This was the second time I did a DNA on a dog. Can’t imagine how they can get it so right! The vet and humane society said she was a lab mix. She is a combo of 25% American Staffordshire Terrier, 25% Catahoula Leopard Dog, 5% Treeing Walker Coonhound, and 25% mixed breed groups. She looks like a runner, slim waist, strong legs, Staffordshire ears, lean pointed snout, slick black fur and long tail. She was about one year old when I brought her home. She had been hurt pretty badly and one eye had been put out. She is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Caron

customer_reviews.title: Great product, answered our questions
customer_reviews.text: We were curious to figure out our rescue's "heritage". We were told by vet they thought dachshund/beagle, family thought dachshund/Ridgeback. I had a sister n law that said he was a mini Pittie cause he has super strong jaws. So we took the plunge and got WisdomPanel! Waiting for results is the hardest part! But it was actually pretty quick after we sent in results. We were surprised to find out he IS 25% Pittie, 25% long hair dachshund (thank god he didn't get the long hair). I posted pic of results. It was also nice to know he is CLEAR on the multidrug resistance. I highly recommend WISDOM PANEL!
customer_reviews.author: Gma2Lydia

customer_reviews.title: OMG what a eye opener
customer_reviews.text: My wife ran across a stray dog 6 years ago and alway wanted to know what it was. People would tell her it was this and that and it was even confusing to the vet. The test told us what her family tree looked like, wow. Now we know. Turn around time was great, results given to her on her birthday, she is now very happy to have the results. The first picture day one, the second 6 years old. The results 50% Chihuahua, 25% Shih Tzu, 12.5% Poodle (miniature), 12.5% Terrier, Hound, Herding.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Save your money or donate it to a rescue group
customer_reviews.text: There is no way the results for my dog are correct. She came back as three breeds - all strong muscular dogs - bull terrier, boxer, and chow. She is skinny and 35 pounds dripping wet with long hair. I am working with the company to have them either send me a new kit to re-test her or to give me my money back. What a waste of $90. Save it or better yet donate it to a local rescue organization.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

customer_reviews.title: Totally incorrect
customer_reviews.text: This is the dog that we submitted DNA for testing. He looks like a poodle but came back as 50% golden retriever, 37% poodle and 13% St. Bernard. So we repeated the test with another company and came back as 75% poodle and 25% golden retriever. The previous dog's DNA was correct, but we feel this one was way off base.
customer_reviews.author: Twin star

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: We are quite disappointed. We've hoped to find out what breed our dog is, or at least get a better idea. The test says he's 25% German Shepard, 25% boxer and the rest just mutt mixes. According to the test, he should weigh about 62-80 pounds. Our dog weighs 48 pounds, is not a boxer, chow, pitt, schnauzer or great Dane. We're really disappointed and think they messed up the sample or just put a bunch of random breeds together. Costumer support was contacted via enmail with a picture of our dog attached but they never replied back.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Finally I know what my mutt is
customer_reviews.text: I got the test kit on sale. The price was 50% off so I got two of them and had both dogs tested. The process was super simple to perform and we were surprised by the results. We also upgraded one dogs tests to include the panel for health issues since she was showing health concerns at the time. We're glad we had this done as we now have a better understanding of the dogs backgrounds .
customer_reviews.author: M.I.

customer_reviews.title: right on the mark
customer_reviews.text: my dog traveled the rainbow bridge last month, did this test kit while she was in the hospital, vet always told me, i think she is part Aussie, i thought part rottie or dobie by the markings, and the lab ears, and shelter when adopted had her card marked shepherd mix....results, dominant, part Aussie, Rottie, Lab, German Shepherd, collie....and mix of other breeds, a true "purebred Heinz57"......giving 5 stars as they were right on the mark with the dominant breeds just as i suspected and wanted to know for the past 16 years.....
customer_reviews.author: daisy fan

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining and answers questions!
customer_reviews.text: When we adopted our puppy from the shelter we had lots of questions! He was with a group of puppies who all looked like shepherds, and he looked like a pit. We had mixed information on what his parentage was and were dying to know! The swab process was simple with two people and our results were processed within two weeks. Merry Christmas Pancho! Santa brought you a DNA test! You are 50% staffy, and 12.5% each Akita, American bulldog, chow, and German Shepherd. I can actually see all of these in various traits and characteristics and this is helpful to know for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not That Useful
customer_reviews.text: I really think this was a waste of money. Everyone I know that has used one of these gets some percentage of Chow in their dog. This is an extremely rare breed in the area and it is very doubtful this many dogs have this breed. Also, knowing that my rescue is 50 percent supermutt isn't all that useful. It is pretty obvious my dog has a significant percentage of Golden Retriever. I think these folks have to work more on their data mining and pony up for more purebred tests to calibrate their answers.
customer_reviews.author: B. Berger

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a doggie DNA test for my mixed breed dog forever, but was quite nervous that I would pay good money to receive a “mixed breed” and not a real result. I received the item promptly (thanks prime), and was able to swab my poor girls mouth, much to her chagrin. Received the results promptly, as expected, within a few weeks. I was VERY pleased with the results! She came back 50% Doberman, 12.5% white Swiss shepherd, 12.5% husky, 12.5% Chinese shar-pei, and 12.5% wild canid (coyote) The online platform was easy to use, the results were clear and easy to understand, and it was fun to see
customer_reviews.author: Aedan

customer_reviews.title: The waiting is the hardest part...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but you have to be patient. We have a rescue puppy that had an unknown father so several of us that adopted a puppy did the Wisdom DNA test and got somewhat surprising results, but results that are likely accurate. Oh, and we all got the exact same results. I know from looking at other reviews and from searches that people often get info that their dog has many different breeds, even some odd breeds, but ours showed our pups are actually the result of 2 different pure breed dogs (4 generations deep). Very neat to get this information and worth the money if you are curious what you 'mutt' is.
customer_reviews.author: CWK

customer_reviews.title: No more questioning "I wonder what mix of breeds my dogs are"
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 kits to test my mix-breed dogs. In the first case, it confirmed my prediction of breed, but in a different % of breakdown (I predicted half Chihuahua & half Jack Russell). She is actually 75% Chihuahua, 25% Jack Russell. With our newest dog, I had predicted half Chihuahua & half Rat Terrier. When the results came back, there were breeds in her that I would have never suspected. But when you mix various breeds together, the results can be unpredictable. She's 50% Chihuahua, 12.5% miniature Poodle, 12.5% Dalmatian and 25% mix breed.
customer_reviews.author: love BBC series

customer_reviews.title: Love this so much and so easy to do I ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much and so easy to do I have a rescue dog that I thought look like a boxer kind of mixed and it ended up not being a boxer it ended up being a couple of different Terriers and other mixes this also helps on making sure the dog doesn't have a certain disease
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Page

customer_reviews.title: I'm serious I'm so glad I did this
customer_reviews.text: SO SO WORTH IT!! I'm serious I'm so glad I did this, I learned a lot about my baby (she was a rescue mutt) and their service is awesome. Money well spent!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyse Christiansen

product_meta.title: Wisdom Panel 3.0 Canine DNA Test - Dog DNA Test Kit for Breed and Ancestry Information
product_meta.description: When it comes to your dog’s health and happiness, there’s so much more than meets the eye. That’s why Wisdom Health invented a state of the art genetic test that helps you learn more about your dog’s ancestry, physical traits, and predisposition towards important health conditions. It’s simple – just order your kit online, swab the inside of your dog’s mouth, and send it back to get your results through our website. We’ll connect the dots to help you care smarter—and love longer.
feature_bullets: DOG DNA BREED ANCESTRY TESTING KIT: With a simple cheek swab you can do at home, the Wisdom Panel test analyzes for more than 350 breeds, types, & varieties. Some customers may receive kits with older packaging that still refers to 250+ breeds; rest assured that your test will be automatically upgraded to the current 350+ breeds, types, and varieties analysis.

THREE SIMPLE STEPS: Simply collect your dog's DNA with a cheek swab, activate your kit online & send your kit to the lab with pre-paid shipping. You'll receive our genetic analysis of your dog's ancestry & breed identification in as little as 2 weeks.

BENEFITS OF DNA ANALYSIS: Genetic testing can help you identify breeds & specific health issues that may be important to the wellbeing of your dog. Work with your veterinarian & use your results to develop training, nutrition & long-term healthcare plans.

BEST IN SHOW: As the leading canine genetics company we’ve tested the DNA of more than 1.5 million dogs & developed the largest & most comprehensive breed database in the world, with a sophisticated algorithm and a very strategically placed set of markers.
DISCOVER MORE ABOUT YOUR DOG: DNA analysis unlocks a brand new world of DNA-based insights that may help you understand your dog's unique appearance, behaviors, and wellness needs.
